title.rendered: You're Invited To The Freelance Isn't Free Event

content.rendered:
📢📢 Freelancers, listen up: On May 15, the Freelance Isn’t Free Act officially becomes law in New York City. This is a momentous day for independent workers and we’re honored to celebrate this victory with the Freelancers Union (!!!!!!).
The Freelance Isn’t Free Act provides basic protections for freelance work, including mandating contracts and stipulating that payments must be made within thirty days of work completion, or clients may be subject to double damages.
As fierce advocates for the freelance workforce, we created our Standard Freelance Contract with the Freelancers Union to protect all independent workers. The intuitive digital template allows freelancers to create a fair and secure agreement in a matter of minutes, and exists as a living, breathing document that can continuously be improved by the freelance community at-large.
We’re proud to celebrate this important victory with Freelancers Union at the Freelance Isn’t Free Launch Party on May 15 at 10 a.m. at WeWork Fulton Center in New York City.
And some good news: you’re invited to join us!
Freelancers Union will have experts on hand to talk about about the new law and how freelancers can protect themselves from nonpayment. In addition to breakfast and coffee, there will also be planned activities such as:

  • Informative “know your rights” sessions led by local lawyers
  • A demo of a new nonpayment tool
  • MANY giveaways & swag
  • A #FreelanceIsntFree photobooth

See you there!
In the meantime, feel free to check out our contract template and our newest tool to help you get paid if a client ever stiffs you.

excerpt.rendered: Join us and Freelancers Union to celebrate the victory of the Freelance Isn’t Free Act becoming law on May 15th.
